trans-unit.source: Get started with delivering Video-on-Demand (VoD) content using .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Get started with delivering Video-on-Demand (VoD) content using .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the steps of implementing a Video-on-Demand (VoD) content delivery application with Azure Media Services using .NET.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the steps of implementing a Video-on-Demand (VoD) content delivery application with Azure Media Services using .NET.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through the steps of implementing a Video-on-Demand (VoD) content delivery application using Azure Media Services (AMS) SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through the steps of implementing a Video-on-Demand (VoD) content delivery application using Azure Media Services (AMS) SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial introduces the basic Media Services workflow and the most common programming objects and tasks required for Media Services development.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial introduces the basic Media Services workflow and the most common programming objects and tasks required for Media Services development.

trans-unit.source: At the completion of the tutorial, you will be able to stream or progressively download a sample media file that you uploaded, encoded, and downloaded.
trans-unit.target: At the completion of the tutorial, you will be able to stream or progressively download a sample media file that you uploaded, encoded, and downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The following prerequisites are required to start developing with Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: The following prerequisites are required to start developing with Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: Operating Systems: Windows 8 or later, Windows 2008 R2, Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: Operating Systems: Windows 8 or later, Windows 2008 R2, Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework 4.5 or .NET Framework 4.0
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework 4.5 or .NET Framework 4.0

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).

trans-unit.source: The following tasks are shown in this Quickstart.
trans-unit.target: The following tasks are shown in this Quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Create a Media Services account (using the Azure portal).
trans-unit.target: Create a Media Services account (using the Azure portal).

trans-unit.source: Configure streaming endpoint (using the portal).
trans-unit.target: Configure streaming endpoint (using the portal).

trans-unit.source: Create and configure a Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: Create and configure a Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new asset and upload a video file.
trans-unit.target: Create a new asset and upload a video file.

trans-unit.source: Encode the source file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files.
trans-unit.target: Encode the source file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset and get URLs for streaming and progressive download.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset and get URLs for streaming and progressive download.

trans-unit.source: Play your content.
trans-unit.target: Play your content.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click New, click Media Service, and then click Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click New, click Media Service, and then click Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Media Services Quick Create</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Media Services Quick Create</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In NAME, enter the name of the new account.
trans-unit.target: In NAME, enter the name of the new account.

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account name is all lower-case numbers or letters with no spaces, and is 3 - 24 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account name is all lower-case numbers or letters with no spaces, and is 3 - 24 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: In REGION, select the geographic region that will be used to store the metadata records for your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: In REGION, select the geographic region that will be used to store the metadata records for your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Only the available Media Services regions appear in the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Only the available Media Services regions appear in the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: In STORAGE ACCOUNT, select a storage account to provide blob storage of the media content from your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: In STORAGE ACCOUNT, select a storage account to provide blob storage of the media content from your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: You can select an existing storage account in the same geographic region as your Media Services account, or you can create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can select an existing storage account in the same geographic region as your Media Services account, or you can create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: A new storage account is created in the same region.
trans-unit.target: A new storage account is created in the same region.

trans-unit.source: If you created a new storage account, in NEW STORAGE ACCOUNT NAME, enter a name for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you created a new storage account, in NEW STORAGE ACCOUNT NAME, enter a name for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The rules for storage account names are the same as for Media Services accounts.
trans-unit.target: The rules for storage account names are the same as for Media Services accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click Quick Create at the bottom of the form.
trans-unit.target: Click Quick Create at the bottom of the form.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.

trans-unit.source: Once your account is successfully created, the status changes to Active.
trans-unit.target: Once your account is successfully created, the status changes to Active.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, the MANAGE KEYS button appears.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, the MANAGE KEYS button appears.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, a dialog with the Media Services account name and the primary and secondary keys is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, a dialog with the Media Services account name and the primary and secondary keys is displayed.

trans-unit.source: You will need the account name and the primary key information to programmatically access the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: You will need the account name and the primary key information to programmatically access the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Media Services Page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Media Services Page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you double-click on the account name, the Quickstart page is displayed by default.
trans-unit.target: When you double-click on the account name, the Quickstart page is displayed by default.

trans-unit.source: This page enables you to do some management tasks that are also available on other pages of the portal.
trans-unit.target: This page enables you to do some management tasks that are also available on other pages of the portal.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can upload a video file from this page or do it from the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can upload a video file from this page or do it from the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: When working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.
trans-unit.target: When working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.

trans-unit.source: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.
trans-unit.target: With adaptive bitrate streaming, the client can switch to a higher or lower bitrate stream as the video is displayed based on the current network bandwidth, CPU utilization, and other factors.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports the following adaptive bitrate streaming technologies: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).

trans-unit.source: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.
trans-unit.target: Media Services provides dynamic packaging which allows you to deliver your adaptive bitrate MP4 or Smooth Streaming encoded content in streaming formats supported by Media Services (MPEG DASH, HLS, Smooth Streaming, HDS) without you having to re-package into these streaming formats.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Encode or transcode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial),
trans-unit.target: Encode or transcode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files (the encoding steps are demonstrated later in this tutorial),

trans-unit.source: Get at least one streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: Get at least one streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: With dynamic packaging, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format, and Media Services will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.
trans-unit.target: With dynamic packaging, you only need to store and pay for the files in single storage format, and Media Services will build and serve the appropriate response based on requests from a client.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of streaming reserved units, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the number of streaming reserved units, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the portal, click Media Services.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, click Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the name of the media service.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the name of the media service.

trans-unit.source: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.
trans-unit.target: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.

trans-unit.source: Then, click on the streaming endpoint that you want to modify.
trans-unit.target: Then, click on the streaming endpoint that you want to modify.

trans-unit.source: To specify the number of streaming units, click the SCALE tab, and then move the reserved capacity slider.
trans-unit.target: To specify the number of streaming units, click the SCALE tab, and then move the reserved capacity slider.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Press SAVE to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Press SAVE to save your changes.

trans-unit.source: The allocation of any new units takes around 20 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The allocation of any new units takes around 20 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: Currently, going from any positive value of streaming units back to none can disable streaming for up to an hour.
trans-unit.target: Currently, going from any positive value of streaming units back to none can disable streaming for up to an hour.

trans-unit.source: The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.
trans-unit.target: The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.

trans-unit.source: For information about pricing details, see <linkText>Media Services pricing details</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about pricing details, see <linkText>Media Services pricing details</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new C# Console Application in Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, or Visual Studio 2010 SP1.
trans-unit.target: Create a new C# Console Application in Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, or Visual Studio 2010 SP1.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, Location, and Solution name, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, Location, and Solution name, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Use the windowsazure.mediaservices.extensions Nuget package to install Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Use the windowsazure.mediaservices.extensions Nuget package to install Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions.

trans-unit.source: The Media Services .NET SDK Extensions is a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your code and make it easier to develop with Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The Media Services .NET SDK Extensions is a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your code and make it easier to develop with Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to System.Configuration assembly.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to System.Configuration assembly.

trans-unit.source: This assembly contains the System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager class that is used to access configuration files, for example, App.config.
trans-unit.target: This assembly contains the System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager class that is used to access configuration files, for example, App.config.

trans-unit.source: Open the App.config file (add the file to your project if it was not added by default) and add an appSettings section to the file.
trans-unit.target: Open the App.config file (add the file to your project if it was not added by default) and add an appSettings section to the file.

trans-unit.source: Set the values for your Azure Media Services account name and account key, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Set the values for your Azure Media Services account name and account key, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the account name and key information, open the Azure portal, select your media services account, and then click the MANAGE KEYS button.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the account name and key information, open the Azure portal, select your media services account, and then click the MANAGE KEYS button.

trans-unit.source: Overwrite the existing using statements at the beginning of the Program.cs file with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Overwrite the existing using statements at the beginning of the Program.cs file with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Create a new folder under the projects directory and copy an .mp4 or .wmv file that you want to encode and stream or progressively download.
trans-unit.target: Create a new folder under the projects directory and copy an .mp4 or .wmv file that you want to encode and stream or progressively download.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the "C:\VideoFiles" path is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the "C:\VideoFiles" path is used.

trans-unit.source: When using Media Services with .NET, you must use the CloudMediaContext class for most Media Services programming tasks: connecting to Media Services account; creating, updating, accessing, and deleting the following objects: assets, asset files, jobs, access policies, locators, etc.
trans-unit.target: When using Media Services with .NET, you must use the CloudMediaContext class for most Media Services programming tasks: connecting to Media Services account; creating, updating, accessing, and deleting the following objects: assets, asset files, jobs, access policies, locators, etc.

trans-unit.source: Overwrite the default Program class with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Overwrite the default Program class with the following code.

trans-unit.source: The code demonstrates how to read the connection values from the App.config file and how to create the CloudMediaContext object in order to connect to Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The code demonstrates how to read the connection values from the App.config file and how to create the CloudMediaContext object in order to connect to Media Services.

trans-unit.source: For more information about connecting to Media Services, see <linkText>Connecting to Media Services with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about connecting to Media Services, see <linkText>Connecting to Media Services with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Main function calls methods that will be defined further in this section.
trans-unit.target: The Main function calls methods that will be defined further in this section.

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, you upload (or ingest) your digital files into an asset.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, you upload (or ingest) your digital files into an asset.

trans-unit.source: The Asset entity can contain video, audio, images, thumbnail collections, text tracks, and closed caption files (and the metadata about these files.)
trans-unit.target: The Asset entity can contain video, audio, images, thumbnail collections, text tracks, and closed caption files (and the metadata about these files.)

trans-unit.source: Once the files are uploaded, your content is stored securely in the cloud for further processing and streaming.
trans-unit.target: Once the files are uploaded, your content is stored securely in the cloud for further processing and streaming.

trans-unit.source: The files in the asset are called Asset Files.
trans-unit.target: The files in the asset are called Asset Files.

trans-unit.source: The UploadFile method defined below calls CreateFromFile (defined in .NET SDK Extensions).
trans-unit.target: The UploadFile method defined below calls CreateFromFile (defined in .NET SDK Extensions).

trans-unit.source: CreateFromFile creates a new asset into which the specified source file is uploaded.
trans-unit.target: CreateFromFile creates a new asset into which the specified source file is uploaded.

trans-unit.source: The CreateFromFile method takes AssetCreationOptions which lets you specify one of the following asset creation options:
trans-unit.target: The CreateFromFile method takes AssetCreationOptions which lets you specify one of the following asset creation options:

trans-unit.source: None - No encryption is used.
trans-unit.target: None - No encryption is used.

trans-unit.source: This is the default value.
trans-unit.target: This is the default value.

trans-unit.source: Note that when using this option, your content is not protected in transit or at rest in storage.
trans-unit.target: Note that when using this option, your content is not protected in transit or at rest in storage.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to deliver an MP4 using progressive download, use this option.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to deliver an MP4 using progressive download, use this option.

trans-unit.source: StorageEncrypted - Use this option to encrypt your clear content locally using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)-256 bit encryption, which then uploads it to Azure Storage where it is stored encrypted at rest.
trans-unit.target: StorageEncrypted - Use this option to encrypt your clear content locally using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)-256 bit encryption, which then uploads it to Azure Storage where it is stored encrypted at rest.

trans-unit.source: Assets protected with Storage Encryption are automatically unencrypted and placed in an encrypted file system prior to encoding, and optionally re-encrypted prior to uploading back as a new output asset.
trans-unit.target: Assets protected with Storage Encryption are automatically unencrypted and placed in an encrypted file system prior to encoding, and optionally re-encrypted prior to uploading back as a new output asset.

trans-unit.source: The primary use case for Storage Encryption is when you want to secure your high-quality input media files with strong encryption at rest on disk.
trans-unit.target: The primary use case for Storage Encryption is when you want to secure your high-quality input media files with strong encryption at rest on disk.

trans-unit.source: CommonEncryptionProtected - Use this option if you are uploading content that has already been encrypted and protected with Common Encryption or PlayReady DRM (for example, Smooth Streaming protected with PlayReady DRM).
trans-unit.target: CommonEncryptionProtected - Use this option if you are uploading content that has already been encrypted and protected with Common Encryption or PlayReady DRM (for example, Smooth Streaming protected with PlayReady DRM).

trans-unit.source: EnvelopeEncryptionProtected – Use this option if you are uploading HLS encrypted with AES.
trans-unit.target: EnvelopeEncryptionProtected – Use this option if you are uploading HLS encrypted with AES.

trans-unit.source: Note that the files must have been encoded and encrypted by Transform Manager.
trans-unit.target: Note that the files must have been encoded and encrypted by Transform Manager.

trans-unit.source: The CreateFromFile method also lets you specify a callback in order to report the upload progress of the file.
trans-unit.target: The CreateFromFile method also lets you specify a callback in order to report the upload progress of the file.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, we specify None for the asset options.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, we specify None for the asset options.

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the Program class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the Program class.

trans-unit.source: After ingesting assets into Media Services, media can be encoded, transmuxed, watermarked, and so on, before it is delivered to clients.
trans-unit.target: After ingesting assets into Media Services, media can be encoded, transmuxed, watermarked, and so on, before it is delivered to clients.

trans-unit.source: These activities are scheduled and run against multiple background role instances to ensure high performance and availability.
trans-unit.target: These activities are scheduled and run against multiple background role instances to ensure high performance and availability.

trans-unit.source: These activities are called Jobs, and each Job is comprised of atomic Tasks that do the actual work on the Asset file.
trans-unit.target: These activities are called Jobs, and each Job is comprised of atomic Tasks that do the actual work on the Asset file.

trans-unit.source: As was mentioned earlier, when working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.
trans-unit.target: As was mentioned earlier, when working with Azure Media Services, one of the most common scenarios is delivering adaptive bitrate streaming to your clients.

trans-unit.source: Media Services can dynamically package a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files into one of the following formats: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).
trans-unit.target: Media Services can dynamically package a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files into one of the following formats: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), Smooth Streaming, MPEG DASH, and HDS (for Adobe PrimeTime/Access licensees only).

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Encode or transcode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.
trans-unit.target: Encode or transcode your mezzanine (source) file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4 files or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.

trans-unit.source: Get at least one streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: Get at least one streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows how to submit an encoding job.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows how to submit an encoding job.

trans-unit.source: The job contains one task that specifies to transcode the mezzanine file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s using Azure Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: The job contains one task that specifies to transcode the mezzanine file into a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s using Azure Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: The code submits the job and waits until it is completed.
trans-unit.target: The code submits the job and waits until it is completed.

trans-unit.source: Once the job is completed, you would be able to stream your asset or progressively download MP4 files that were created as a result of transcoding.
trans-unit.target: Once the job is completed, you would be able to stream your asset or progressively download MP4 files that were created as a result of transcoding.

trans-unit.source: Note that you do not need to have more than 0 streaming units in order to progressively download MP4 files.
trans-unit.target: Note that you do not need to have more than 0 streaming units in order to progressively download MP4 files.

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the Program class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the Program class.

trans-unit.source: To stream or download an asset, you first need to "publish" it by creating a locator.
trans-unit.target: To stream or download an asset, you first need to "publish" it by creating a locator.

trans-unit.source: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.
trans-unit.target: Locators provide access to files contained in the asset.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports two types of locators: OnDemandOrigin locators, used to stream media (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, or Smooth Streaming) and Access Signature (SAS) locators, used to download media files.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports two types of locators: OnDemandOrigin locators, used to stream media (for example, MPEG DASH, HLS, or Smooth Streaming) and Access Signature (SAS) locators, used to download media files.

trans-unit.source: After you create the locators, you can build the URLs that are used to stream or download your files.
trans-unit.target: After you create the locators, you can build the URLs that are used to stream or download your files.

trans-unit.source: A streaming URL for Smooth Streaming has the following format:
trans-unit.target: A streaming URL for Smooth Streaming has the following format:

trans-unit.source: A streaming URL for HLS has the following format:
trans-unit.target: A streaming URL for HLS has the following format:

trans-unit.source: A streaming URL for MPEG DASH has the following format:
trans-unit.target: A streaming URL for MPEG DASH has the following format:

trans-unit.source: A SAS URL used to download files has the following format:
trans-unit.target: A SAS URL used to download files has the following format:

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK extensions provide convenient helper methods that return formatted URLs for the published asset.
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK extensions provide convenient helper methods that return formatted URLs for the published asset.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses .NET SDK Extensions to create locators and to get streaming and progressive download URLs.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses .NET SDK Extensions to create locators and to get streaming and progressive download URLs.

trans-unit.source: The code also shows how to download files to a local folder.
trans-unit.target: The code also shows how to download files to a local folder.

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the Program class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the Program class.

trans-unit.source: Once you run the program defined in the previous section, the URLs similar to the following will be displayed in the console window.
trans-unit.target: Once you run the program defined in the previous section, the URLs similar to the following will be displayed in the console window.

trans-unit.source: Adaptive streaming URLs:
trans-unit.target: Adaptive streaming URLs:

trans-unit.source: Smooth Streaming
trans-unit.target: Smooth Streaming

trans-unit.source: HLS
trans-unit.target: HLS

trans-unit.source: MPEG DASH
trans-unit.target: MPEG DASH

trans-unit.source: Progressive download URLs (audio and video).
trans-unit.target: Progressive download URLs (audio and video).

trans-unit.source: To stream you video, use <linkText>Azure Media Services Player</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To stream you video, use <linkText>Azure Media Services Player</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To test progressive download, paste a URL into a browser (for example, Internet Explorer, Chrome, or Safari).
trans-unit.target: To test progressive download, paste a URL into a browser (for example, Internet Explorer, Chrome, or Safari).

trans-unit.source: To learn more about building Video-on-Demand applications, see <linkText>Build VoD applications</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about building Video-on-Demand applications, see <linkText>Build VoD applications</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services 101 - Get your video online now!
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services 101 - Get your video online now!

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services 102 - Dynamic packaging and mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services 102 - Dynamic packaging and mobile devices

trans-unit.target: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=255386
